meanings.definition: The act of making something sexual or arousing.
meanings.sent1: The eroticization of the movie scenes made them more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The eroticization of the perfume advertisement appealed to many viewers.
meanings.sent3: The eroticization of the dessert menu raised some eyebrows at the family restaurant.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings had a subtle eroticization that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The novel's plot had a surprising eroticization that left a lasting impression.

meanings.definition: The process of imbuing something with sexual desire or attraction.
meanings.sent1: The eroticization of the music video enhanced its popularity.
meanings.sent2: The eroticization of the dance performance added a sensual element.
meanings.sent3: The eroticization of the office party theme sparked some giggles among colleagues.
meanings.sent4: His poetry had a deep emotional eroticization that touched many hearts.
meanings.sent5: The garden's design had a natural eroticization that drew visitors from afar.
